page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: The area consisting of the districts of South Park, Meadvale, Earlswood and part of the town of Reigate/Redhill,is situated in the south of the Borough of Reigate and Banstead. Geographically two thirds of the area forms part of the Low Weald of Surrey;the underlying rock being clay.The northern third sits astride the Lower Greensand Ridge;the substratum being sandstone. Half of the area is farmland. Of the remainder,half is common land, and the rest is occupied by houses; the majority built between{1840}and {1975}and 25% of them local authority owned. A notable landmark is St.Johns Church,Redhill built{1842}with its tall spire seeable from many parts of the district.
